From: "C. Diekmann" <diekmann@in.tum.de>
Dear Makarius,

I know it is a bit late for a feature request for the upcoming
release, but this one is really uncritical.

Is it possible to add an example to the build usage? I always need to
look up its usage. In particular, the current usage description does
not directly tell how to generate a proof document.

=== What I wish for ==
$ isabelle build --help
[...]Isabelle2015-RC5/lib/Tools/build: illegal option -- -

Usage: isabelle build [OPTIONS] [SESSIONS ...]

Options are:
[...]

Example:
Build the session with the name `Session_Name' in the current
directory and generate a pdf proof document.

$ isabelle build -v -o document=pdf -d . Session_Name
=== End what I wish for ==

Regards,
Cornelius

From: Makarius <makarius@sketis.net>
In the "system" manual there is section 2.3 "Invoking the build process",
which starts with a copy of the command-line usage, with some extra
explanations. (This is a general principle for most Isabelle command-line
tools.)

Moreover, at the end of the section there are various examples.

The subsequent chapter in the manual is then about the whole complex of
document preparation.

Makarius
